author: Redacción LAVOZ
title: La tormenta azotó Río Tercero: árboles caídos, postes derribados y techos volados
text:
La
tormenta que se desató en la tarde de este jueves en el sur de la provincia de Córdoba llegó a la ciudad de Río Tercero. Las autoridades de la Municipalidad informaron que fue acompañada de ráfagas de viento que alcanzaron los 100 km/h y una intensa precipitación de aproximadamente 40 milímetros en tan solo 13 minutos.
Este fenómeno meteorológico causó severos inconvenientes en diversas zonas de la ciudad.
Río Tercero: daños por la tormenta
En este marco, desde la Municipalidad informaron que los principales daños ocasionados por la tormenta fueron:
- La caída de una gran cantidad de ramas y árboles, que dificultaron la circulación en diversas calles.
- Cortes de cables y derribo de postes eléctricos, lo que dejó algunas zonas sin servicio.
- La voladura de techos en viviendas, especialmente en sectores más expuestos a las ráfagas de viento.
Afortunadamente, hasta el momento no se reportaron personas lesionadas ni evacuaciones en la ciudad.
En tanto, las autoridades solicitaron a los vecinos extremar las precauciones, evitando circular por las calles afectadas por los escombros y árboles caídos.
Asimismo, recomendaron a los ciudadanos mantenerse alejados de las zonas con cables caídos y otras situaciones de riesgo.
En caso de emergencia, invitaron a la comunidad a reportar las situaciones a los números habilitados por el municipio para una rápida asistencia.

author: Correspondent - Unlimited Digital Access
title: How Indiana women's basketball beat Nebraska in Lincoln Sunday
text: Early risers: How another hot start propels Indiana women's basketball to a Big Ten win After Sunday’s matchup between [Indiana women’s basketball](/story/sports/college/iu/2024/01/07/indiana-basketballs-xavier-johnson-returns-to-form-in-ohio-state-win/72099563007/) and Nebraska only two teams remain undefeated in Big Ten conference play — Indiana and Iowa. Indiana (13-1) halted Nebraska’s (11-4) perfect conference run with a 91-69 win in Lincoln. It was a team effort with four Hoosiers scoring in double-digits, with the team shooting 61% and dishing 22 assists. “It feels good to come off of a performance like we did at Michigan and then come in here today in a very tough environment and play really good basketball,” said IU head coach Teri Moren. “It feels good for us and our performance, but we also know that this game can be fickle sometimes and so we have to make sure we continue to keep our foot on the pedal.” All-American guard Mackenzie Holmes led the Hoosiers with 22 points, while [Sydney Parrish added 20](/story/sports/college/iu/2024/01/05/sydney-parrish-helps-indiana-womens-basketball-vs-michigan-perfect-first-quarter-teri-moren-big-ten/72110473007/), Sara Scalia 19 and Chloe Moore-McNeil 16. More: [Sydney Parrish helps Indiana women's basketball get rolling early against Michigan](/story/sports/college/iu/2024/01/05/sydney-parrish-helps-indiana-womens-basketball-vs-michigan-perfect-first-quarter-teri-moren-big-ten/72110473007/) Another explosive first quarter for IU's Sydney Parish For the second straight game, Parrish shot 100% from the field in the first quarter, going 4-for-4 from beyond the arc. Since Jan. 4 Parrish is 9-for-11 from 3-point range. Parrish has provided an early offensive cushion for the Hoosiers. In Thursday's win over Michigan Parrish hit five shots as IU was a perfect 13-for-13 in the first period. “Seeing a couple (shots) go down last game against Michigan (helped)," Parrish said. "A lot of shooters just need to see one go in and then it will propel you for the next game." Parrish finished the game with a new season-high of 20 points. The recent outside scoring surge has also helped create more opportunities down low for Mackenzie Holmes. “This group in particular does a great job of is finding each other and finding each other when they feel like someone has the hot hand,” Moren said. “It’s no mistake that (Parrish) had teammates out there that were trying to feed her and find her.” Mackenzie Holmes vs. Alex Markowski Nebraska center Alexis Markowski up against Holmes provided a physical, old-school Big Ten matchup around the basket. Averaging 17.2 points per game as well as 9.9 rebounds, Markowski challenged Holmes, holding her to eight points in the first half. Markowski also showed her range, canning two from beyond the arc and finishing with 21 points. She picked up her fourth foul early in the third quarter and had to sit, which opened the door for Holmes. Men's basketball: ['Let him loose': IU's Xavier Johnson gets game ball after win over Ohio State](/story/sports/college/iu/2024/01/07/indiana-basketballs-xavier-johnson-returns-to-form-in-ohio-state-win/72099563007/) Fast play for Hoosiers The Hoosiers forced an up-tempo pace against the Huskers to push their lead to 13 at half. The speed and pressure of the Hoosiers’ defense forced the Huskers into 19 turnovers that Indiana converted into 24 points. “I didn’t like the pace in the first quarter," Moren said. "I thought it was too slow for us." Efficient ball movement on the offense opened up Holmes and Parrish, as well as Scalia and Moore-McNeil. Up next for Indiana women Indiana returns home on Wednesday as they host Penn State (10-4, 1-2 in Big Ten). Penn State is the last game before the Hoosiers face the no. 4 Iowa Hawkeyes.

author: @Tripadvisor
title: Social Media Specialist Job Description - Let's Find Out!
text:
If you wish to become a social media specialist, you must consider reading ahead, as you can find almost all details here in this job description. The social media specialists are mainly responsible for creating various social media posts for companies.
However, they also need to report to some managers and work perfectly with the digital marketing team to generate social media strategy that would promote customer engagement and specific brand awareness.
They are mainly responsible for creating or publishing content on all social media platforms like Facebook and Instagram to grow as a target audience. The specialist might also oversee site metrics, grow as a target audience and build brand awareness. They need to understand the company’s target audience and specific interactions.
They are also responsible for planning, monitoring, and implementing their social media strategy to enhance brand awareness, improve marketing efforts, and boost sales. The main aim is to ideally achieve superior customer engagement and intimacy, website traffic, and income by strategically exploiting the social media marketing roadmap elements.
Above all, the experts need to have a strong understanding of how social media works and optimize content so that it tends to engage on the respective social media channels. In addition, they are responsible for joining relevant conservations on the brand’s behalf and soft selling by providing support to prospective clients.
Contents
Job Description – Social Media Specialist Skills Required – Social Media Specialist Job Responsibilities Job Requirements Frequently Asked Questions 1 What is the scope of a social media specialist in the current times? 2 Are the social media specialists required to be well-versed with different software and tools? 3 How much experience is required to apply for this role? Job Description – Social Media Specialist A company looks for a professional and enthusiastic social media expert to join its creative team. The expert is likely to be responsible for creating various social media campaigns and regular management tasks. In addition, their passion for social media as a communications tool is expected to result in the adoption and implementation of social media best practices across various media channels.
The successful candidate is likely to be a fantastic communicator, a versatile creative writer, and a team player. In addition, they need to be active participants in data collection and analyses to improve the organization’s social media practices consistently.
You need to attract and engage with the target audience. Above all, you need to help in developing and implementing our social media tips. You need to build some online presence and improve advertising, sales, and marketing efforts.
A company aims to hire creative, forward-thinking, and organized social media specialists to join its company. Under this position, one can interact with a targeted audience and promote their products and services.
Lastly, the experts need to post meaningful content on social media platforms besides acting gracefully to resolve all customer queries or criticisms posted on various social media channels. They are also responsible for promoting companies and boosting client engagement by implementing multiple tools. It includes improving the company’s web presence and supervising or monitoring the digital content creation.
Read more: How Fast Is USPS Media Mail?
Skills Required – Social Media Specialist To become a successful social media specialist, you need you to need to have some unique skills. First, you need to have fantastic communication skills, including written and oral. Besides that, you should have vital interpersonal skills and problem-solving skills. Finally, they need to have critical decision–making skills.
Job Responsibilities Develop social media content plans that tend to be consistent with the company’s brand identity. The social media specialist should also create consistent and meaningful content on various social media plans, like writing and editing multiple posts. They should also manage a high volume of various daily posts. They should also communicate with social media followers, like responding to queries on a given deadline. Job Requirements Must have a bachelor’s degree in journalism, communications, marketing, or a given niche. The social media specialist must also be able to work in a fast-paced and high-pressure working environment. Need to have experience using various analytics software. Need to have at least three years of social media experience like planning and managing content in a company. Frequently Asked Questions 1 What is the scope of a social media specialist in the current times? Ans. Every company, be it a product or a service company, is looking to grow itself on the different social media platforms. Hence, currently, there is a huge demand for social media specialists out there. There is cut-throat competition in this field.
2 Are the social media specialists required to be well-versed with different software and tools? Ans. social media is not just about framing the content and posting, as it is a lot more than this. A social media specialist must have good knowledge about the software and tools to track the performance of the account, do a thorough competitor analysis, etc.
3 How much experience is required to apply for this role? Ans. There is no mandatory minimum number set to apply for this role. It depends on the company you are applying for. However, the more practical experience you have working in this field, the better it is.
5/5 - (60 votes)
